channel.title: Wtf, illeagle start of expression

item.title: Wtf, illeagle start of expression
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Replace:

	public void pitNPC(int pit, int npcType, int x, int y, int WalkingType) {
	int HP = server.npcHandler.GetNpcListHP(npcType);	
		int slot = -1;
		for (int i = 1; i < server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i++) {
			if (server.npcHandler.npcs[i] == null) {
				slot = i;
				break;
			}
                 }
            }
        public void updateCharAppearance(int[] styles, int[] colors) {
		for(int j = 0; j < 7; j++) {
			if(styles[j] > 0) {
				styles[j] += 0x100;
				pCHead  = styles[0];
				pCBeard = styles[1];
				pCTorso = styles[2];
				pCArms  = styles[3];
				pCHands = styles[4];
				pCLegs  = styles[5];
				pCFeet  = styles[6];
			}
		for(int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
			pColor = colors[i];
		}
	}
}

item.title: Wtf, illeagle start of expression
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

easy one ^^

k if you goth the error its say something like this :

lleagle start of expression public void exampel();

now notify lleagle start of expression means you ahve a } short

so go above exampel();

end add one if the error come back add another one keep this doing until it gone if you add to mutch you will get errors

~supra

Edit:
i have looked add your code end you need more then 1

new code :

public void pitNPC(int pit, int npcType, int x, int y, int WalkingType) { int HP = server.npcHandler.GetNpcListHP(npcType); int slot = -1; for (int i = 1; i < server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i++) { if (server.npcHandler.npcs[i] == null) { slot = i; break; } } } // maybe you need to add 1 more not sure public void updateCharAppearance(int[] styles, int[] colors) { for(int j = 0; j < 7; j++) { if(styles[j] > 0) { styles[j] += 0x100; pCHead = styles[0]; pCBeard = styles[1]; pCTorso = styles[2]; pCArms = styles[3]; pCHands = styles[4]; pCLegs = styles[5]; pCFeet = styles[6]; } for(int i = 0; i < 5; i++) { pColor = colors[i]; } } }

item.title: Wtf, illeagle start of expression
item.dc:creator: @ChemicalReaction1 ChemicalReaction™
item.description:
@ChemicalReaction1 wrote:

Basicly. i have this code:

public void updateCharAppearance(int[] styles, int[] colors) { for(int j = 0; j < 7; j++) { if(styles[j] > 0) { styles[j] += 0x100; pCHead = styles[0]; pCBeard = styles[1]; pCTorso = styles[2]; pCArms = styles[3]; pCHands = styles[4]; pCLegs = styles[5]; pCFeet = styles[6]; } for(int i = 0; i < 5; i++) { pColor = colors[i]; } } }

But when i compile. it sais illeagle start of expression. pointing to the p on public.
This is what its like above it :

public void pitNPC(int pit, int npcType, int x, int y, int WalkingType) { int HP = server.npcHandler.GetNpcListHP(npcType); int slot = -1; for (int i = 1; i < server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i++) { if (server.npcHandler.npcs[i] == null) { slot = i; break; } public void updateCharAppearance(int[] styles, int[] colors) { for(int j = 0; j < 7; j++) { if(styles[j] > 0) { styles[j] += 0x100; pCHead = styles[0]; pCBeard = styles[1]; pCTorso = styles[2]; pCArms = styles[3]; pCHands = styles[4]; pCLegs = styles[5]; pCFeet = styles[6]; } for(int i = 0; i < 5; i++) { pColor = colors[i]; } } }

I tryed adding } above. but that didnt help either
